result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marlon Ivan Sanchez

defendant.name: Sanchez, Marlon Ivan
defendant.address: N3619 Ogema Prentice Rd, Prentice, WI 54556

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

10:00 AM DA calls cases 22CF08, and 22CM02 and states appearances. Defendant Marlon Ivan Sanchez appeared with attorney Luke J Fischer.  Karl J. Kelz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Victim Rights Legislations have been complied with. DA Kelz states an agreement has been reached. In case 22CF08 the defendant will plea to both counts and in case 22CM02 the defendant will plea to CT. 2 and the State will move to dismiss Ct. 1. Court questions Attorney Fischer on Preliminary hearing in 22CF08. Preliminary Hearing waived by defendant freely, voluntarily, and intelligently.  Waiver accepted by the Court.   Court finds probable cause exists that a crime was committed and binds DE over for trial. Information filed, acknowledged by parties and reading waived. DE enters plea of NO CONTEST to Counts 1 and 2 in 22CF08 and count 2 in 22CM02 therefore Ct. 1 in case 22CM02 is DISMISSED.   Court questions DE regarding the plea. DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC on Count 2 in case 22CF08 and Count 2 in case 22CM02. Court orders Deferred Entry on Judgement entered on Count 1 in case 22CF08.
  
22CF08
Ct. 1- DEJ for 2 years 
Ct. 2- Withheld Sentence-
2 Years Probation 
Conditions of Probation:
$400 Fine 
$200 DNA + Sample 
$3,500 Restitution 
10 Days in the Price County Jail with HUBER privileges and is to commence within 30 days of 05/23/2022 (Consecutive to 22CM02)
Defendant is given 0 days Sentence credit 
Probation/ Jail term may be served in ANY County in the State of Wisconsin

22CM02
Ct. 1- DISMISSED
Ct. 2- Withheld Sentence-
2 Years Probation 
Conditions of Probation:
$300 FIne 
$200 DNA + Sample 
AODA Assessment 
20 Days in the Price County Jail with HUBER privileges and is to commence within 30 days of 05/23/2022
Defendant is given 0 days sentence credit
Probation/ Jail term may be served in ANY County in the State of Wisconsin


Appeal rights Given
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant may not have contact with the individual(s): JLS Unless a written waiver is filed with the Clerk of Courts office or the Price County Sheriff's Dept after hours. 
 *No Contact includes: Going to or remaining in any place the individual resides, is employed at, attends school at, or any public location the individual is temporarily located. Contact through means of telephone. Electronic devices, Social media, email, regular mail, or a 3rd party individual is prohibited. The only exception to this order is contact through your attorney or law enforcement in appropriate circumstances.

10:11 AM Defendant Marlon Ivan Sanchez appeared in court. Karl J. Kelz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint acknowledged, reading waived. Bond recommendations by DA Kelz. Bond ordered as requested.   Preliminary hearing requested, time limits waived. Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.
Demand for discovery and notice of intent to use DNA
